snippet: Officials said the would-be attacker dispatched by the Yemen branch of Al Qaeda to blow up an airplane was actually a Saudi agent who infiltrated the group.
abstract: American and foreign officials reveal that the would-be suicide bomber dispatched by Al Qaeda in the Arab Peninsula to blow up a United States-bound airliner was actually a Saudi intelligence agent who infiltrated the terrorist group and volunteered for the mission; in an intelligence coup, the Saudi spy turned over both the bomb and key data on the terrorist group; officials say that the agent operated in Yemen with the full knowledge of the Central Intelligence Agency, but not under its direct supervision.

byline.original: By SCOTT SHANE and ERIC SCHMITT
byline.contributor: Robert F. Worth and Michael S. Schmidt contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Officials said the would-be attacker dispatched by the Yemen branch of Al Qaeda to blow up an airplane was actually a Saudi agent who infiltrated the group.

headline.seo: Suicide Mission Volunteer Was Double Agent, Officials Say
headline.main: Double Agent Disrupted Bombing Plot, U.S. Says
headline.print_headline: Airline Plotter A Double Agent, U.S. Officials Say

keywords.value: Al Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula
keywords.name: organizations
